The model module¶

class model.Entity(thing)[source]¶

Bases: object

An entity in the model corresponds to a thing in the world. Attributes are converted to predicates here.

class model.Model[source]¶

Bases: object

mk_speaker_model(world, num_entities)[source]¶

In this setup, the model is initialised with a random set of experiences for the speaker.

mk_truth_theoretic(world)[source]¶

In this setup, the model is a perfect reflection of the world.

print_me()[source]¶

Output model

true_interpretation(u)[source]¶

The interpretation function in a truth-theoretic setting. Given an utterance (proposition or predication), return a truth-value (proposition) and/or a set (predication).

class model.Situation(scene)[source]¶

Bases: object

A situation in the model corresponds to a scene in the world.
